title: RME-Based Instructional Workshop for High School Mathematics Teacher Professional Development (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of high school mathematics curriculum and basic teaching methodologies, basic awareness of Realistic Mathematics Education (RME) concepts
context.additional_context: Participants collaborate in real-time via Zoom within smartphone-based limited technology environments, submitting final outputs through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Applying the four-stage RME (Realistic Mathematics Education) process (presenting real-life contexts → exploring informal strategies → refining mathematical representations → formalization), learners develop a one-week module solving ≥3 daily math problems (e.g., budget allocation, statistical interpretation, ratio calculations) and submit demonstration materials meeting ≥4 out of 5 peer rubric criteria (e.g., realism, mathematical refinement, applicability).

Using LSLC learning community practices (e.g., regular feedback sessions, collaborative lesson design workshops), learners collaborate with two peer teachers to derive ≥1 lesson improvement plan and achieve ≥20% satisfaction enhancement in pre-post lesson effectiveness evaluations.
In a one-week RME course, learners use multi-tiered assessments (two formative quizzes, one summative project report) to achieve ≥80% mastery in ≥4 out of 5 rubric criteria.

resources: LSLC (Learning Support Learning Community) Operation Template
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
